application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by a 1m eastern lateral reduction, a 2m southern and western lateral reduction and a crown lift to provide 6m clearance to One Oak (T1 on application), a crown lift to provide 6m clearance to One Oak (T7 on application), a 10m height reduction to One Group of Hornbeams (G10 on application) and to remove One Oak (T8 on application) all within Area 1 on TPO 398
decision_conditions: The trees at 69 Copse wood way collectively have a high amenity value and significantly contribute to the arboreal character of the local area, helping to create a gradual transition between Ruislip Woods and the Copse Wood Estate (Area of Special Local Character).

The recent planning application (12231/APP/2022/1910) included a tree report and as part of this included permission to carry out a lateral reduction on the western side by 3m to T7 One Oak, all further works within this tree application (12231/TRE/2022/225) are additional and were not recommended within the planning application tree report dated 25th April 2022. The applicant states work is to maintain the trees in context with the soon to be built house and as a result they were given the opportunity to include this report within 2231/APP/2022/3054 Details pursuant to the discharge of conditions of planning permission ref. 2231/APP/2022/1910, however this was not taken up.

The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
